body: Dipanwita works on information extraction, coreference resolution, and relation classification for Bengali. She leads the BengaliNER project and contributes to the BengaliQA evaluation benchmark development.
title: Dipanwita Roy

body: Fahmida coordinates Bāk's partnerships with schools, diaspora organizations, and community annotator networks. She leads the BākoLearn platform design and manages the Heritage Learner fellowship program in the UK.
title: Fahmida Islam

body: Imran develops computational grammars and morphological analyzers for Bengali and its dialects. He is the primary architect of BengaliUD and co-authored the BengaliMorphBench evaluation framework.
title: Imran Ghosh

body: Dr. Ahmed leads Bāk's NLP infrastructure work, including development of BākoCorpus and BākoLM. Previously a senior research scientist at Google Brain, he brings expertise in large-scale pretraining, multilingual NLP, and responsible AI to our team. He supervises three postdoctoral researchers.
title: Dr. Karim Ahmed

body: Dr. Rahman founded Bāk Institute in 2019 after completing his PhD in computational linguistics at MIT. His research covers large language models, Bengali syntax, and the social dimensions of language technology. He has published over 40 peer-reviewed papers and received the ACL 2022 Best Paper Award.
title: Dr. Minhaj Rahman

body: Dr. Chakraborty is a formal linguist specializing in Bengali morphosyntax. She leads the BengaliUD treebank project and the BengaliMorph analyzer. Her work bridges formal generative linguistics and computational implementation, ensuring Bāk's NLP tools are linguistically rigorous.
title: Dr. Mohua Chakraborty

body: Nusrat manages Bāk's data pipelines, corpus storage, and cloud infrastructure. She designed the BākoCorpus 2.0 data collection and deduplication system, processing over 50TB of raw Bengali web data for the release.
title: Nusrat Islam

body: Prof. Das is a leading authority on Bengali dialectology and experimental phonetics. She leads Bāk's fieldwork programs, overseeing corpus collection in Sylheti, Chittagonian, and Rajshahi dialects. Her 2025 Journal of Phonetics paper on Chittagonian tonal variation has been cited 80+ times since publication.
title: Prof. Priya Das

body: Dr. Sen's work focuses on finite-state morphology and low-resource NLP. She leads development of the BengaliMorph analyzer and contributes to the Universal Dependencies treebank annotation effort.
title: Dr. Riya Sen

body: Tanvir builds and evaluates neural MT systems for Bengali-centric language pairs. He led the Bengali↔Hindi parallel corpus construction effort (500K sentence pairs) and maintains BākoMT, the Institute's open MT model.
title: Tanvir Hossain
